_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Farm Product Raw Material Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    MFA Bulk Fertilizer Plant - Brookfield

Location:    27635 Hwy FF, Brookfield, Mo.

Contact:      Mick Pate

Phone:     6    60-258-2284





1. The Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of the MFA Bulk Fertilizer Plant near Brookfield are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Linn County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of dry fertilizer, and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient.



The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a rail tank car holding approximately 160,000 pounds.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law, and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia".



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



    The facility has;



        a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 

                 1910.38;



        b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and 

                 community right-to-know information as required under SARA Tit

le III 

               (EPCRA);



        c. employees will not respond to any releases other than to activate an emergency

                 shut-off while evacuating the facility. Local emergency responders will be

                 notified to control any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA 2.1-2014 and Process Management of Highly Hazardous Chemical and will make the required upgrades as needed.







    4/7/16
